com.yantra.api.wms.move

Interface modifyMoveRequest

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface modifyMoveRequest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document modifyMoveRequest(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      modifyMoveRequest provides ability to modify an existing move request.

    • Method Detail

      • modifyMoveRequest

        org.w3c.dom.Document modifyMoveRequest(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException

        modifyMoveRequest provides ability to modify an existing move request. Move requests only in CREATED status can be modified.
        Following are the scenarios under which move request can be modified:

        1. Move request has an exception (i.e. move request is partially tasked):
          • Attributes like RequestUserId, StartNoEarlierThan, FinishNoLaterThan and Priority can be modified.
          • Move request line attributes that can be modified are:
            • For action MODIFY, only RequestQuantity can be modified. If RequestQuantity becomes less than or equal to ReleasedQuantity then line becomes released. This is indicated by setting ReleasedFlag to 'Y' and if all other lines were already released or cancelled, then this change triggers the move request status to RELEASED.
            • For action CANCEL, all tasks associated with this line are cancelled. This is indicated by setting CancelledFlag to 'Y'.
              • If the cancellation of line leads to cancellation of a summary task and if all the other summary tasks for the move request were already cancelled or completed, then this change triggers the move request status to CLOSED.
              • If no line has yet been released and this line is the last line being cancelled, then move request status becomes CLOSED.
              • If at least one line is released and this line is the last line being cancelled, then move request status becomes RELEASED.

        2. Move request has no exception (i.e. not at all tasked):
          • Other than unique key attributes (MoveRequestNo, Node) of move request entity, other attributes like RequestUserId, StartNoEarlierThan, FinishNoLaterThan and Priority can be changed.
          • For move request lines, same behavior as explained above.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction MODIFY_MOVE_REQUEST.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of modifyMoveRequest.
            Data published - WMS_MODIFY_MOVE_REQUEST.ON_SUCCESS.xml

        Audits:
        A status audit corresponding to move request is created (if at all status changes) with the following values in the YFS_Move_Request_Status_Audit table:

          OldStatus:- previous status of the Move Request.
          NewStatus:- 'RELEASED' or 'CLOSED'.
          OldStatusDate:- date when status of the Move Request was last changed.
          NewStatusDate:- Current DB Date.

        Pre Conditions:
        Move request being modified should exist in the database.
        Move request should be in CREATED status.

        Post Conditions:
        Move request record gets updated with the passed values.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        No output XML.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
